term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - spatially resolving detector
term.title: spatially resolving detector

item.text: A detector for the measurement of the spatial distribution of the radiation. Spatially resolving detectors can be divided into two groups: the photosensitive area consists of a matrix of discrete photosensitive elements, the pixels (picture elements) forming an array with the facility to separately read out the information, simultaneously or sequentially. the photosensitive area consists of a single photosensitive element that must be scanned (e.g. image dissection tube.)
